name: uEZ
short_description:
uEZ(r) is an open source, embeddded middleware platform providing underlying RTOS and processor abstraction features enhancing portability of application code to multiple ARM and Renesas platforms with high reusability. 

Developed by Future Designs, Inc. at http://www.teamfdi.com

Doxygen docs available at http://www.teamfdi.com/uez/docs/index.html

uEZings blog: http://uezings.wordpress.com/

uEZ is now available in a self-extracting 7-Zip executable for Windows in addition to the standard zip file. The 7z download is a much smaller file size.
http://www.7-zip.org/

Use 7-Zip to open .7z archive files: https://sourceforge.net/projects/sevenzip

uEZ 2.06b release introduces Crossworks 3.2 support.

uEZ 2.06c release introduces support for the uEZGUI-1788-70WVM-BA revision 2.0.

uEZ 2.07 coming soon with faster boot-up times, floating point support on LPC4088, and more!
summary: Open Source middleware platform with FreeRTOS, processor abstraction
